meanings.definition: The act of corrugating or the state of being corrugated.
meanings.sent1: The corrugation of the cardboard added strength to the box.
meanings.sent2: I could see the corrugation in the metal roof of the shed.
meanings.sent3: The corrugation in the road made the car bounce up and down like a rollercoaster.
meanings.sent4: Her face showed the corrugation of years of laughter and smiles.
meanings.sent5: The corrugation of the waves crashing against the shore was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A wrinkle; a fold; a furrow; a groove; a crease.
meanings.sent1: The corrugation in the fabric gave it a unique texture.
meanings.sent2: I noticed a corrugation in the paper where it had been folded.
meanings.sent3: The corrugation in the carpet made it look like a mini mountain range.
meanings.sent4: His forehead showed the corrugation of worry and stress.
meanings.sent5: The corrugation in the tree bark provided a hiding spot for insects.
